page.title: 19Dialect in Durris
page.content: In our block,many farmers and older folk speak in the dialect of the North-East,which is called Doric. Jock:Fit like ee Dod? Dod:Och,nae sae gweed!Av bin hyowin neeps aa day,an a wiz near drookit. It wiz fair dingin doon! Jock:Fairly at!Did ye speer at Wullie gin he wid be doonby i nicht? Dod:Na!He wiz oot wi the kye fin I stoppit by,fur thid loupit i dyke. Which roughly translated means! John:How are you George? George:O,not so good!I was hoeing turnips all day,and I was almost drowned.It was raining heavily! John:Quite so!Did you ask William if he would call in this evening? George:No!He was with the cows when I looked in,as they had jumped over the wall.
